summary: The client proposal was completed as planned, but only one PR was reviewed instead of all, and the 30-minute walk was skipped due to an unexpected production issue and low afternoon energy.
insights: Unexpected issues can significantly impact planned tasks.
Low energy in the afternoon affected productivity and ability to complete physical activity.
Prioritizing critical tasks helped complete the most important goal.
lessons_learned: Build buffer time into the schedule to accommodate unexpected issues.
Consider scheduling physically demanding activities during higher energy periods.
Focus on prioritizing tasks when time is limited.
tomorrow_suggestions: Allocate specific time blocks for PR reviews with buffer for interruptions.
Schedule the walk earlier in the day when energy levels are higher.
Prepare contingency plans for unexpected issues to minimize disruption.
